config.question: Why was the farmers’ grievance regarding rising railroad rates between 1870 and 1900 unjustified?

choices.content: Railroad rates actually fell during these years.
The government had offered farmers transport subsidies.
The farmers relied more on waterways and canals.
Railroad rates had not changed during these years.

answer_3.response: Consider This: American farmers complained bitterly about declining prices for their products, rising railroad rates to ship them, and burdensome mortgages. Shippers of all products benefited during this time. See L.O. 20.2 What factors led to the formation and growth of the Farmers’ Alliance and People’s party?
